alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 1:48AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Crawford and Marion. In northwest Ohio, Wyandot. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. A few roads with high water have been reported this morning and additional rain moving into the region will only allow for high water to persist overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Galion, Morral, Marseilles, Harpster and Kirby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
